paragraphs.content: Psalm 89
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 89

paragraphs.content: Maschil of Ethan the Ezrahite.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Maschil of Ethan the Ezrahite.

paragraphs.content: I will sing of the mercies of the LORD for ever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will sing of the mercies of the Lord for ever: with my mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.

paragraphs.content: For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever: thy faithfulness shalt thou establish in the very heavens.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever: thy faithfulness shalt thou establish in the very heavens.

paragraphs.content: I have made a covenant with my chosen, I have sworn unto David my servant,
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have made a covenant with my chosen, I have sworn unto David my servant,

paragraphs.content: Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne to all generations. Selah.

paragraphs.content: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O LORD: thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O Lord: thy faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints.

paragraphs.content: For who in the heaven can be compared unto the LORD? who among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the LORD?
paragraphs.contentHtml: For who in the heaven can be compared unto the Lord? who among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the Lord?

paragraphs.content: God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, and to be had in reverence of all them that are about him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints, and to be had in reverence of all them that are about him.

paragraphs.content: O LORD God of hosts, who is a strong LORD like unto thee? or to thy faithfulness round about thee?
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord God of hosts, who is a strong Lord like unto thee? or to thy faithfulness round about thee?

paragraphs.content: Thou rulest the raging of the sea: when the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou rulest the raging of the sea: when the waves thereof arise, thou stillest them.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thine enemies with thy strong arm.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast broken Rahab in pieces, as one that is slain; thou hast scattered thine enemies with thy strong arm.

paragraphs.content: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine: as for the world and the fulness thereof, thou hast founded them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The heavens are thine, the earth also is thine: as for the world and the fulness thereof, thou hast founded them.

paragraphs.content: The north and the south thou hast created them: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The north and the south thou hast created them: Tabor and Hermon shall rejoice in thy name.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast a mighty arm: strong is thy hand, and high is thy right hand.

paragraphs.content: Justice and judgment are the habitation of thy throne: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Justice and judgment are the habitation of thy throne: mercy and truth shall go before thy face.

paragraphs.content: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O LORD, in the light of thy countenance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound: they shall walk, O Lord, in the light of thy countenance.

paragraphs.content: In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In thy name shall they rejoice all the day: and in thy righteousness shall they be exalted.

paragraphs.content: For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy favour our horn shall be exalted.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou art the glory of their strength: and in thy favour our horn shall be exalted.

paragraphs.content: For the LORD is our defence; and the Holy One of Israel is our king.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the Lord is our defence; and the Holy One of Israel is our king.

paragraphs.content: Then thou spakest in vision to thy holy one, and saidst, I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then thou spakest in vision to thy holy one, and saidst, I have laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

paragraphs.content: I have found David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have found David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him:

paragraphs.content: With whom my hand shall be established: mine arm also shall strengthen him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: With whom my hand shall be established: mine arm also shall strengthen him.

paragraphs.content: The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The enemy shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness afflict him.

paragraphs.content: And I will beat down his foes before his face, and plague them that hate him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And I will beat down his foes before his face, and plague them that hate him.

paragraphs.content: But my faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But my faithfulness and my mercy shall be with him: and in my name shall his horn be exalted.

paragraphs.content: I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will set his hand also in the sea, and his right hand in the rivers.

paragraphs.content: He shall cry unto me, Thou art my father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He shall cry unto me, Thou art my father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.

paragraphs.content: Also I will make him my firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Also I will make him my firstborn, higher than the kings of the earth.

paragraphs.content: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My mercy will I keep for him for evermore, and my covenant shall stand fast with him.

paragraphs.content: His seed also will I make to endure for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His seed also will I make to endure for ever, and his throne as the days of heaven.

paragraphs.content: If his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If his children forsake my law, and walk not in my judgments;

paragraphs.content: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;

paragraphs.content: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes.

paragraphs.content: Nevertheless my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Nevertheless my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him, nor suffer my faithfulness to fail.

paragraphs.content: My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My covenant will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone out of my lips.

paragraphs.content: Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie unto David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Once have I sworn by my holiness that I will not lie unto David.

paragraphs.content: His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His seed shall endure for ever, and his throne as the sun before me.

paragraphs.content: It shall be established for ever as the moon, and as a faithful witness in heaven. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: It shall be established for ever as the moon, and as a faithful witness in heaven. Selah.

paragraphs.content: But thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with thine anointed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with thine anointed.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast made void the covenant of thy servant: thou hast profaned his crown by casting it to the ground.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strong holds to ruin.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast broken down all his hedges; thou hast brought his strong holds to ruin.

paragraphs.content: All that pass by the way spoil him: he is a reproach to his neighbours.
paragraphs.contentHtml: All that pass by the way spoil him: he is a reproach to his neighbours.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast set up the right hand of his adversaries; thou hast made all his enemies to rejoice.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast also turned the edge of his sword, and hast not made him to stand in the battle.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast made his glory to cease, and cast his throne down to the ground.

paragraphs.content: The days of his youth hast thou shortened: thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The days of his youth hast thou shortened: thou hast covered him with shame. Selah.

paragraphs.content: How long, LORD? wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?
paragraphs.contentHtml: How long, Lord? wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thy wrath burn like fire?

paragraphs.content: Remember how short my time is: wherefore hast thou made all men in vain?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Remember how short my time is: wherefore hast thou made all men in vain?

paragraphs.content: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: What man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.

paragraphs.content: Lord, where are thy former lovingkindnesses, which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lord, where are thy former lovingkindnesses, which thou swarest unto David in thy truth?

paragraphs.content: Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Remember, Lord, the reproach of thy servants; how I do bear in my bosom the reproach of all the mighty people;

paragraphs.content: Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O LORD; wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherewith thine enemies have reproached, O Lord; wherewith they have reproached the footsteps of thine anointed.

paragraphs.content: Blessed be the LORD for evermore. Amen, and Amen.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed be the Lord for evermore. Amen, and Amen.
